author: Nick Castillo
title: National Writer: Texas must fix error, hire Oliver Luck as Athletic Director
text:
Sports Illustrated's Pete Thamel wrote in an article Tuedsay that Texas was 'busy counting the money from its new television network and playing realignment bully' when it surprisingly hired Steve Patterson over Oliver Luck as its athletic director.
Patterson was fired on Tuesday and now Texas' new athletic director will have to fix his mistakes.
"New Texas president Gregory Fenves, who was hired in June, finds himself having to clean up the errors of his predecessor, Bill Powers," Thamel wrote. "It was Powers and the hiring committee who Patterson charmed with his dynamic in-person interview to prompt them to make the surprise hire ... As Texas starts over again, Fenves would be wise to do what Powers neglected to doâ”make the obvious hire in Oliver Luck."
He also said that the Longhorns' overlooked Luck's rÃ©sumÃ© which featured both athletic and business experience. Thamel said Texas will now have to look at an athletic director candidate like Luck, Kansas State's John Currie, Arizona's Greg Byrne, Louisville's Tom Jurich or Mississippi State's Scott Stricklin.
Whoever the Longhorns decide to hire, they'll have to fix the errors Patterson made during his 22-month tenure at Texas.
"Patterson now leaves bullet holes that will require more than a few Band-Aids to fix," Thamel wrote. "His era blew up in such a fantastic mushroom cloud of donor angst, season-ticket-holder revolt and awkwardly handled firings that the mess he inherited actually gets overlooked ... Patterson's tenure is a reminder that charm and warmth are still part of the job description for college athletics, no matter how big the business has gotten."
